fields.title: Afghanistan: WFP Weekly Market Price Bulletin: Issue 148 (3rd Week of April 2023)
fields.body:
**Highlights**

Due to the fact that the lean season is almost complete in most parts of the country, the main commodities prices have started to decline compared to last week. However, the prices of rice, pulses and sugar are substantially high compared to the 2-year average. Given that Eid is approaching, the prices of some staple commodities are expected to increase.

The purchasing power of unskilled casual labour and livestock keepers improved by 1% and 0.4%, respectively, mainly due to decreased wheat prices, increased labour wage and sheep price compared to the previous week. The ToT for one-year female sheep and unskilled casual labour to wheat is improved compared to last year too.

Comparing to last week, the value of Afghani against USD is slightly improved due to Zakat in month of Ramadan and more remittances from out side for the families living in Afghanistan for Eid preparation. The value of Afghani against US Doller is below comparing to last year same time and average level.

Due to the fact that the lean season is almost complete in most parts of the country, the main commodities prices have started to decline compared to last week. The purchasing power of unskilled casual labour and livestock keepers improved by 1% and 0.4%, respectively, mainly due to decreased wheat prices, increased labour wage and sheep price compared to the previous week. The ToT for one-year female sheep and unskilled casual labour to wheat is improved compared to last year too.

Comparing to last week, the value of Afghani against USD is slightly improved due to Zakat in month of Ramadan and more remittances from out side for the families living in Afghanistan for Eid preparation. text:
# Afghanistan: WFP Weekly Market Price Bulletin: Issue 148 (3rd Week of April 2023)

**Highlights**

Due to the fact that the lean season is almost complete in most parts of the country, the main commodities prices have started to decline compared to last week. However, the prices of rice, pulses and sugar are substantially high compared to the 2-year average. Given that Eid is approaching, the prices of some staple commodities are expected to increase.

The purchasing power of unskilled casual labour and livestock keepers improved by 1% and 0.4%, respectively, mainly due to decreased wheat prices, increased labour wage and sheep price compared to the previous week. The ToT for one-year female sheep and unskilled casual labour to wheat is improved compared to last year too.

Comparing to last week, the value of Afghani against USD is slightly improved due to Zakat in month of Ramadan and more remittances from out side for the families living in Afghanistan for Eid preparation. The value of Afghani against US Doller is below comparing to last year same time and average level.
summary: This bulletin provides an overview of the market prices of main commodities in Afghanistan during the third week of April 2023. Prices of rice, pulses, and sugar are high compared to the two-year average, and are expected to increase due to the approaching Eid. The purchasing power of unskilled casual labour and livestock keepers improved due to decreased wheat prices, increased labour wage, and increased sheep price. The value of Afghani against USD is slightly improved due to Zakat in Ramadan and more remittances from outside for Eid preparation, but is still lower than last year's same time and average level.
